evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On October 3, 2023, President Biden nominated Plaintiff Hampton Dellinger to be Special Counsel of the Office of Special Counsel.

extracted.value: On October 3, 2023, President Biden nominated Plaintiff Hampton Dellinger to be Special Counsel of the Office of Special Counsel.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Senate confirmed Mr. Dellinger on February 27, 2024, and he was sworn in as Special Counsel on March 6, 2024.

extracted.value: The Senate confirmed Mr. Dellinger on February 27, 2024, and he was sworn in as Special Counsel on March 6, 2024.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On February 7, 2025, at 7:22 PM, Special Counsel Dellinger received an email from Sergio Gor, Assistant to the President and the Director of the White House Presidential Personnel Office, which stated in its entirety: “On behalf of President Donald J. Trump, I am writing to inform you that your position as Special Counsel of the US Office of Special Counsel is terminated, effective immediately. Thank you for your service[.]”

extracted.value: On February 7, 2025, at 7:22 PM, Special Counsel Dellinger received an email from Sergio Gor, Assistant to the President and the Director of the White House Presidential Personnel Office, which stated in its entirety: “On behalf of President Donald J. Trump, I am writing to inform you that your position as Special Counsel of the US Office of Special Counsel is terminated, effective immediately. Thank you for your service[.]”

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The one-sentence email does not allege any inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance in office by Special Counsel Dellinger, nor could it.

extracted.value: The one-sentence email does not allege any inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance in office by Special Counsel Dellinger, nor could it.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: President Trump has also attempted to remove Board Member Gwynne Wilcox from the National Labor Relations Board despite clear statutory for-cause removal protection.

extracted.value: President Trump has also attempted to remove Board Member Gwynne Wilcox from the National Labor Relations Board despite clear statutory for-cause removal protection.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Over the preceding three weeks, an unprecedented number of federal employees with civil service protections have been terminated without cause. Senior career officials have been purged from the Federal Bureau of Investigations.

extracted.value: Over the preceding three weeks, an unprecedented number of federal employees with civil service protections have been terminated without cause. Senior career officials have been purged from the Federal Bureau of Investigations.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Special Counsel Dellinger’s purported termination has sown confusion about his authority to lead the OSC and jeopardized the agency’s functioning.

extracted.value: Special Counsel Dellinger’s purported termination has sown confusion about his authority to lead the OSC and jeopardized the agency’s functioning.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Motion to Stay the Courts Administrative Stay
evidence.text: On February 7, 2025, the President removed Plaintiff Hampton Dellinger as the head of the Office of Special Counsel (OSC).

extracted.value: On February 7, 2025, the President removed Plaintiff Hampton Dellinger as the head of the Office of Special Counsel (OSC).

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Motion to Stay the Courts Administrative Stay
evidence.text: Plaintiff filed this action on February 10, 2025, ECF No. 1, and later that day, filed a motion for a temporary restraining order, ECF No. 2.

extracted.value: Plaintiff filed this action on February 10, 2025, ECF No. 1, and later that day, filed a motion for a temporary restraining order, ECF No. 2.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Motion to Stay the Courts Administrative Stay
evidence.text: Just a few hours later— and before Defendants could even file a brief in response to Plaintiff’s motion for a temporary restraining order—this Court ordered an “administrative stay,” ordering Plaintiff to be reinstated to the position that he no longer occupied.

extracted.value: Just a few hours later— and before Defendants could even file a brief in response to Plaintiff’s motion for a temporary restraining order—this Court ordered an “administrative stay,” ordering Plaintiff to be reinstated to the position that he no longer occupied.

evidence.source_document: Defendants' Motion to Stay the Courts Administrative Stay
evidence.text: Defendants have now appealed the Court’s administrative stay and are requesting an emergency stay pending appeal from the United States Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit.

extracted.value: Defendants have now appealed the Court’s administrative stay and are requesting an emergency stay pending appeal from the United States Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit.
